intro: Stenandriopsis boivinii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dark green, ovate leaves and showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for tropical gardens. Due to its unique flowering habit and ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its beauty and fragrance.
